title: Can't play Roblox Unblocked on the browser
content:
Roblox was blocked on my device and I wanted to get it unblocked and play it on Infrexa with Firefox. I already followed steps mentioned on the official webpage: https://www.infrexa.com/now-gg-roblox-login-and-play-roblox-unblocked-on-your-browser so please don't advise similar troubleshooting methods.

Now I am able to play roblox but the problem is that when I play the Roblox through "Mozilla Firefox" it shows an error "Firefox is already running but is not responding" and then becomes unresponsive when pressing refresh button, the fan gets faster and device heats up with too much hanging. But when I open the Roblox through "Chrome" it comparatively works good and asks for login details and after redirection it allows me to play Roblox Unblocked without any issue. "Roblox unblocked" here simply means a technical sense, meaning “not crashing” or “free from software or network errors and or browser malfunction".

I have been using Firefox for a long time and my passwords and user ids are saved in the browser so I want to continue using "Firefox" as default browser but I am having the issue in playing roblox unblocked and other games through Firefox browser. I think the current issue that I have started facing is especially after a recent windows update.

I also tried many other gaming platforms like Official Roblox.com, Now.gg Roblox, easyfun.gg and web.cloudmoonapp.com but all of them faced same issues on Firefox while running ok on Chrome.

I am currently running Windows 11 (25H2 Licensed version). I want to play roblox unblocked on my device using Firefox (updated). My parents have already allowed me to play Roblox and I am playing it on my own device and internet connection. Please fix the browser issue and unblock Roblox for me. Please also check my browser version against Windows 11 compatibility if possible.

If you fix this issue for me, I will be grateful to you.

FF 141.0 on FreeBSD, only extension is NoScript.

title: Touchscreen stops scrolling and zooms instead, touch can no-longer activate tabs or other widgets when this happens
content:
On my steam deck, from time to time, the firefox's touchscreen support seems to switch modes.

The symptoms are: 

- Instead of scrolling, one-finger touch-and-drag now zooms in and out (depending on direction) - The touchscreen no longer lets me select or close tabs, or focus or click in-page widgets - This mode-switch is restricted to the firefox window in which it happens   - Moving the tab to a new window results in the new window working fine   - Other existing windows are unaffected (although they may later experience a touch mode switch  event)

I have yet to determine what triggers this switch, nor can I figure out how to undo it.

title: How Can I Fix Rendering Issues on Firefox for My Website?
content:
Hi everyone,

I run AHS Rankers (https://ahsrankers.com/), a site that lists and ranks auto repair shops, and I’ve noticed that some pages don’t render correctly in Firefox. Elements like tables, images, and menus sometimes appear misaligned, even though the site works fine in Chrome and Edge.

I’ve tried:

  • Clearing caches and cookies
  • Updating CSS for responsive design
  • Testing in Firefox Developer Edition

Despite this, the layout still breaks on certain pages. I’m looking for guidance on:

  • Firefox-specific CSS or HTML quirks to watch out for
  • Debugging tools within Firefox for layout issues
  • Best practices for ensuring cross-browser compatibility

Has anyone else experienced layout problems on Firefox, especially with content-heavy or interactive pages? Any tips, resources, or solutions would be much appreciated!

Thanks in advance!
creator: ahsrankers

title: How Can I Fix Rendering Issues on Firefox for My Website?
content:
Hi everyone,

I run AHS Rankers (https://ahsrankers.com/), a site that lists and ranks auto repair shops, and I’ve noticed that some pages don’t render correctly in Firefox. Elements like tables, images, and menus sometimes appear misaligned, even though the site works fine in Chrome and Edge.

I’ve tried:

  • Clearing caches and cookies
  • Updating CSS for responsive design

Despite this, the layout still breaks on certain pages. I’m looking for guidance on:

  • Firefox-specific CSS or HTML quirks to watch out for
  • Debugging tools within Firefox for layout issues
  • Best practices for ensuring cross-browser compatibility

Has anyone else experienced layout problems on Firefox, especially with content-heavy or interactive pages? Any tips, resources, or solutions would be much appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

title: "Always ask you where to save files" is definitely broken. Can we please open a bug report for it?
content:
This setting, "Always ask you where to save files," is definitely broken.

In a related article, they provided this solution: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/que.../1534384 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1534384]

Proposed solution: "I believe you also need to go into Tools -> Settings -> General and set the Action for the types of downloads (Applications) to Always Ask for those types you want it to."

But this workaround should not be needed. "Always ask" means always ask. As in always. No other additional steps should be needed.

Can you folks please open a bug to get this fixed? This used to work just fine in (much) older versions of Firefox and Netscape. "Always ask" is supposed to mean always ask. Like, always.

title: MetaMask Add-on Performance Issue on Mozilla Firefox
content:
The MetaMask browser extension is extremely slow and unresponsive when used in Mozilla Firefox. Actions such as opening the wallet, switching networks, approving transactions, or interacting with dApps take a long time or freeze temporarily.

This issue occurs only in Firefox. MetaMask works smoothly and as expected on other browsers (for example, Chromium-based browsers) and all other websites and browser extensions load and function normally in Firefox. This suggests the problem is specific to the MetaMask add-on behavior within Firefox rather than general browser performance.

Impact:

Delayed transaction approvals

Lag while opening the extension

Poor user experience when interacting with dApps

Productivity impact when using Web3 applications
